text: Pitch black with moderate, light brown, semi-densed head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma are mostly roasted malts - chocolate, cocoa and a little coffee. Also very nice dark fruits profile, along with some mineral notes, just a slight coffee acidity. Medium body, texture is creamy, silky, carbonation is soft, finish is chocolate, light to moderately roasted. Really balanced and drinkable with great mouthful.

Bottle shared by Pilsnertest, many thanks! Pours very dark brown with dirty, white head. Chalky aroma and taste with bits of chocolate, wood, scorched earth and a bit of liquorice. Pretty light and watery, lacks complexity.

Bottle at home. Burnt wood and coffee. Sweet liquorice. Berries. Dry aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Beeroda.hu Tasting Session @ Budapest.

Dark brown color, creamy beige head. Light toasted aroma. Light to medium-bodied. Milky, toasted, licorice, sweetish flavor. Quite simple. Should try without nitro.

Bottle, 650 ml from Beergium. Shared with rest at the grand tasting 11/2016. pours dark brown with small light brownish head. Average to heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, dark fruit notes. Medium sweetness, with some light dry bitterness in finish. Medium bodied.

From the Christmastime BIF Swap. Tricyclist supplied the 650 mL bottle. Thanks! 
 Cola-dark brown liquid allows a haughtily manhandled sandy-beige flour-clump to perch atop as burnt bread, walnuts, sorghum molasses, toasted dates, blueberry leaves, used medium-roast coffee grounds, and sweat aromas erupt from within to a greater, visibly interested audience. 
 Good charcoal balance. A little fiery by its hot mid-palate. Almond milk chocolately sultriness accompanied with just-hit bong water, grilled apples, birch bark, and graham flour experienced most prominently at swallow. Menacingly swishable, and deadly. After the fourth swig I was feeling unquestionably hammered. 
 Nice and firm like a pair of tits, but it was hard to continue when I felt just so incredibly inebriated by only a couple drinks alone.
One of the best porters Ive had. I went to another site and they were like oh I poured at 44 degrees and into a fucking blah blah blah. Its a GOOD FUCKING BEER! Thats all that matters, right!

Really dark brown color with brown head. Aroma is nice and fudgy with sweet chocolate and dark malts. Taste follows with dark chocolate and roasted malts, really balanced and easy drinking. Light body but really smooth on the palate. Overall its a really good porter, soft and tasty.
EDark with floating particles. Coconut with coffee and vanilla with some alcohol. Chocolate, char, fruity sweetness. Long, charred finish.

Bottle from Beergium. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, nuts, a bit of hops, licorice, a bit of chocolate and coffee. Bitter finish with roasted malts, nuts, a bit of hops, licorice, a bit nuts, chocolate and coffee. Very nice porter.

Bomber. Clear dark burgundy-brown pour with a tall tan head with OK retention. Notes of roasted malts, chocolate, salted caramel, toffee, light hop bitterness and a very subtle metallic bitterness in the end. A nice sessionable porter, quite well balanced and relatively light.
Bottle: Poured a dark brown with tan head. Strong roast. Very strong roast. Light leaf, bitter chocolate, toffee, roast malt.

0,66l from bottle at a friends party. black colour, small tan head. smells licorice, earthy, light dried fruits, spices, light caramel, nice smell. Medium to full body, light carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of spices, licorice, lightly earthy, some caramel, light sherry, light dried fruits. finishes lightly dry with notes of licorice, spices and light dried fruits. nice but also not overly complex, drinks good though.
Had on draft at waterfront in key west. Cherry and cocoa- super velvet mouthfeel. Good stuff
Negro con reflejos caoba y espuma beis. Aromas de chocolate negro, café, ahumados. Sabor intenso como en aroma y amargor acafetado.

Bottle 1 pint 94 floz. [other label which doesnt mention Robust]. Served into a teku glass. Deepest dark brown, good two finger frothy tan head, slowly receding with thin layer remaining, ; aroma roasted malts, cocoa, licorice; smooth and mild taste, medium sweet and light bitter, roasted, chocolate, light dried fruits, spicy touch; mild sweetbitter aftertaste, chocolate lingers on, bit licorice; medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation; well-made mild porter, easy to drink.

660ml bottle (thanks Mart). Very dark brown color. Medium size, yellowish head, stays. Roast, sweet, caramel, malty and toffee in aroma. Sweet, malty, some prunes, woody and roast in taste. Roasted dry and bit dusty malts in aftertaste. Quite nice.

Bottle. Pours black with brownish head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is roast malt, cocoa. Flavor is sweet and bitter, roast, malt, dusty notes, cocoa. Finish is dark chocolate bitter. Overall: very good.

sample from bottle, poured a thick rich brown colour with a deep tanned head. nose of sweet caramel, toasted malts, sweet coffee, dark chocolate, molasses,light bitter roast, charred cacao taste. full bodied mouthfeel for the abv.

Refrigerated brown bomber poured into an English pint glass. Black with dark brown highlights and small beige head. Aroma is dark malt, medium body, low carbonation, and small-bubble lacing. Taste is dark malt, coffee, caramel malt, some chocolate, and slightly bitter her hop finish.
650ml bottle from GT Package in Grovetown. Excited to see! Cocoa. Dark Chocolate. Caramel. Molasses. Nicely bittersweet and slightly ashy. All the ticks are hit for style. 13.8
Tap @ Liquor Express - pours pitch with a tan head, settles beautifully, like a Guinness. Aroma is chocolate, caramel, and as it warms, red fruits. Very nice!

Draft at Liquor Express. Pours Coca Cola brown with an inch of khaki foam. This one takes a while to settle. Leaves some lacing in the glass. Big caramel malts on the nose. Lots of creamy caramel malt on the tongue. Very quaffable and easy to drink. Finished clean. Really nice one to session. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours coffee brown with a thick and rather persistent tan head. Aroma features chocolate, roast malt, caramel, toffee and subtle molasses notes, more stout-like than porter-like. Flavor delivers semi-sweet chocolate, roast malt, charred hops, toffee, caramel and molasses notes. This is YUUUUUGE! Mouthfeel offers firm, viscous body and good fizz. Barkin good!

Black with a thick tan head. Sweet coco nose smooth and malty. Full bodied a bit silky with a dry finish

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Almost black pour. Small tan head. No lacing. Roasted malt nose with hints of chocolate and molasses. Taste is dry malt sweetness, slight molasses, fig, and chocolate. A little thin.

22 ounce bottle purchased at the brewery. Pours a rich, opaque brown with a small tan head that lingers nicely. Aroma is roasty malt and dark chocolate. Taste follows the aroma, with a slight emphasis on the chocolate. Flavor opens up as the beer warms up. A solid porter

Poured from a bomber into a pint glass. The appearance is a black color with a very small brown head. The aroma is a simple mix of caramel and roasted malt, excellent smell. The taste matches the aroma. A very good porter.
22 oz bomber pours a black color with a tan head. Aromas of roasted malt, chocolate, light caramel. Full bodied, an excellent porter.

Bottle thanks to Homer via Hoff! Pours near black with a dark brown head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a strong dark grain note with roasted malts and a bit of bitter chocolate. Flavor has dry dark grains and roasted malts throughout with a bit of bitter chocolate underneath.

750ml bottle. 4/12/16 bottle date. Appearance: Black, opaque, with dark ruby tint and a moderate khaki head that dissipated quickly. 
Aroma: Dark roasted coffee and dark chocolate upfront, with a touch of toffee. Coffee and chocolate aromas are stronger than most in this style. 
Taste: Dark roasted malt dominates, with a strong coffee bean and dark chocolate flavor. Light caramel and toffee in the background. Bitterness is moderate, just enough to balance the maltiness. 
Mouthfeel: Medium body with light viscosity, and a low carbonation. 
Finish: Dry, with dark roast and chocolate prominent and touch of astringency. 
Overall: Good robust Porter, heavier on the roast/coffee character than most other versions. Thankfully, the roast character isnt overly astringent. Caramel and toffee undertones balance out the sharp and bitter roast.

22oz bottle. Pours black with a small creamy brown head. Roasty aroma of chocolate and coffee. Mildly sweet with a heavy roasted chocolate malt character with a bit of caramel. Medium-to-full bodied with a roasted malt finish. Very good.

Bomber courtesy of tricyclist. Thanks. Bottles 04/13-16. Dark brown color with a small beige that recedes to a fine film. The aroma is very mild with sweet cocoa. The taste is weak cocoa, a bit of red fruits and some caramel. The palate is not as full as I prefer a porter and it finishes short and metallic. Overall: not my favorite. 

Edit: as I work my way through the bottle I keep detecting a sour note. Possibly this beer has the beginnings of an infection. Something is definitely off in this porter.
Bottle, dark cocoa color with perfect frothy tan head, lots of roast and earthy notes , somewhat bitter finish, reminds me of the maduro
Black color small white head. Aroma is smokey, roasted w/ some chocolate. Flavor is roasted coffee w/ some chocolate and caramel help to lend a bit of depth.

Tap @CCB
Nitro. Dark brown color, creamy beige head. Light toasted aroma. Light to medium-bodied. Milky, toasted, licorice, sweetish flavor. Quite simple. Should try without nitro.
Nitro. Dang this was a great porter especially creamy with nitro treatment. Deep brown. Roast, chocolate, some vanilla.smooth and mellow. Yum.

February 26, 2016. Bottle, shared by tkrjukoff, thanks! 


Black with a large brownish hrad. Aroma is green paprika, apple, slight earthy, light roasted, herbal, some sourish notes. 
Taste is light sweet, herbal and light roastiness with a slight green paprika, herbal finish with juniper, thyme, earth, hints of coffee. Medium bodied, soft to average carbonation.

Bomber courtesy of tkrjukoff. Pours hazy dark brown with a huge pale mocha head that slowly dissipates while leaving some sticky lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty with rustic dark bread, toasted malts, coffee, paprika and moist soil. Taste is very tiny sweet, tiny sour, tiny malty and malty. Mouthfeel is round, sparkling and medium bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and tiny bitter with rustic sourdough bread, caramel, hay, moist soil, dark roast coffee, paprika, leather, hazelnut skins and moist soil. Defect but not infected (I think). Huge carbonation and fairly strange malt notes.
A: Pitch black with a huge light brown head! N: Coffee, caramel, tiramisu T: Coffee, green pepper. O: Very carbonated! Infected?

On nitro at Mad Mex in West Philly. Crimson brown with a creamy beige head. Nose is coffee, cocoa and caramel. Super silky with a soft tingle. Tastes like it smells; the roasty notes balancing the malty sweetness with nutty hints. Very quaffable.

On tap, pours deep dark brown with a tan head. Aroma is earthy, dark chocolate, roast and a hint of caramel. Taste is nice bitterness with a sweet finish. Medium bodied, a little sticky and overall fantastic porter.
Tap at cigar city, tampa. Black color, smooth white head. Aroma has roasty notes, coffee, some fruity notes. Smooth roasty body, coffee, vanilla notes, some hops at the end.

Not robust, but it is a nice porter. Low rating only because it said robust. Puppys breath is very cute name as it is a nice and friendly beer. Happy and good to come home to, but hopefully doesnt pee on the floor. Slightly translucent black red. Aroma has barley and malt. Taste is calm with standard form. Nice mouth with felt/velvet feel. Nitro tap

Nitro tap - fair size creamy head, very dark Amber/brown color, good size roasty malt and chocolate aroma and flavor, fair hop balance, smooth nitro finish, very good porter overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On nitro. Pours a dark brown with a silky smooth, tan head. Mild roasted aroma. Smooth mouthfeel. Light notes of chocolate and dark roast in the favors. Nothing remarkable.
Dark dark brown pour. Aroma is near perfect. Clean roasted malt with a touch of nuts and chocolate. Taste is sweet version of nose with mild hitter finish.
12oz can at tasting. Brown black body. Sweet brown malt. Coffee aroma, taste. Toffee, sweet, sugary. Rather reminiscent of their brown ale.

From notes. 07/26. 22 oz bottle shared by Spencer. The pour is a dark dark brown or light black with a huge light tan head that prevented full pours for three different attempts. There is huge lacing left all over. The aroma is big on light chocolate and good roasted malt. There is a little lactose in there, but for a porter, it's pretty good. The flavor starts off not very good. Way too much carbonation. There is a lot of bitter cocoa and roasted malt. There is a strange metallic aspect to a light fruit that I'm not too fond of. It's still not bad. The mouth feel isn't really good. There is a ton of carbonation and it's really thin and light. The aftertaste is lingeringly chocolatey with a little roast.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle split @ CBC Clerko. Deep brown pour with a modest tan head. Fresh baked glazed donuts and pain au chocolate. Plenty of toasted grain. Assertive earthy coffee, burnt marshmallow and brown sugar. The taste is nicely balanced, not overly sweet or bitter. Chocolate donuts offset by robust coffee and hop bitterness. General charred grain. Smooth and easy to drink. Oily. Nicely executed.
Bottle. Dark ruby pour with a small, fading head and no lacing. A lot of chocolate in the aroma. Dark chocolate, cinnamon toast, and a little ripe fruit. Good stuff.

22oz bottle. Small off-white head atop crystal clear red-black body. Aroma is moderately sweet, roast, milk chocolate, light earthy, bittersweet chocolate. Taste is sweet, roast, milk chocolate, light molasses, earthy, faint smoke. Medium body, light stickiness.

Pours black, nice creamy tan head not a strong smell, but is roasty and maybe a hint of chocolate, full body creamy palate, only slightly estringint, definite roasty notes

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Heavy dark chocolate and mild coffee for the malt, light herbs and earth for the hops and yeast. Head is small, wispy, off-white with a spot or two of lacing, and is mostly diminishing. Color is dark brown with a red tint. Flavor starts lightly to moderately acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and bitter. Palate is on the fuller side of medium, slick with a lively carbonation. Nothing outrageous in this Porter, but everything is in the right place for the style.

Keg at CC brewpub, 19/02/15.
Dark mahogany brown with a decent tan covering, good lacing ensues.
Nose is light roast, dark fruit notes, raisens, light spice, chocolate.
Taste comprises light charr, chocolate, toffee fudge, light spice, biscuit, raisens.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Decent enough porter.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Serving: from bottle labeled Puppys Breath Porter (no "Robust").

Aroma: light malt and chocolate.

Appearance: average-sized, light brown initial head with good lacing and mostly diminishing longevity. Clear, cola-brown body.

Taste: lightly sweet and chocolatey initial flavor and moderately sweet and roasty finish with average duration.

Palate: light-to-medium body, watery texture and lively carbonation.

Overall: just another porter.

Jacksonville bottle. Pours out dark brown with a huge brown head and foamy lacing that lasts. Aroma is a mixture of baking and sweeter chocolate. Nice espresso bitterness in the flavor. Very nice porter that reminded me somewhat of a dry stout at times. Phenomenal with fresh, sweet strawberries.

Pours a very dark, almost opaque brown that holds a smallish head of tan.
Aroma of chocolate and roast malts.
The flavor is lightly sweet, roasty, nutty and chocolate delivered on a full bodied smooth palate.
Pours dark with lots of tan head. Roasted malt, cocoa and coffee notes abound. Really nice porter.

650 ml bottle. Cheers veliemboys. Pours a dark brown colour with a small head. Aroma of chocolate biscuit, some earthiness and burnt caramel. Flavour of harsh chocolate maltiness, burnt caramel, some unpleasant sourness and grass. Medium bodied. The sourness here is unpleasant.

65 cl bottle. Bottled on 21.11.2014.
Pours dark red, almost black color with a medium sized off-white head. Moderately fruity aroma, some hops, caramel and some dark malts too. Slightly sourish taste, ripe fruit notes, some caramel malts and cocoa. This doesnt feel to be at a mint condition, slightly sour. A disappointment.
3324

65 cl bottle @ olio, bottled 21.11.2014
Aroma is somewhat fruity with hay and cocoa. Flavour has salty licorice, hay, some coffee and slight milky acidicness. Palate is a bit too high on CO2. Decent but nothing special, the lactic tones disturb me a bit.

650ml bottle, thanks Sami!
Bottled 11/24/14 - 
Pours pitch black with a smooth head. Aroma of roasty malts, chocolate, cocoa, hints of syrup, hops and caramel. Taste is roasty, hoppy and robust with some maltiness, chocolate, cocoa and hints of syrup. Finish is smooth, slick and slightly roasty with hints of chocolate and cocoa. Pretty smooth and balanced porter.
22 oz bottle shared with friends. Dark brownish black with light tan head. Aromas of roast, chocolate toffee. Tastes of coffee, roast, dark chocolate, bits of vanilla. Medium body with a dry finish.

On tap at The Brass Tap (Tampa). 
Opaque and essentially black in the glass. Excellent, sticky lacing. 
Flavor is about mid-way between Amer. Porter (with extra hops) and Baltic Porter. Black coffee in the finish and aftertaste, with a touch of smoke. Mildly bitter, increasing into the aftertaste. 

O: a fine porter.
Excellent porter. Pours a very very dark brown with minimal head and lacing. Aromas and flavors of cocoa, charred wood and caramel. Slightly bitter finish.

bottle. smells of light roast and a bit of caramel. tastes of bakers chocolate, giving way to caramel. coffee hints in the finish with a nice chalky mouthfeel that just feels right lingering with the flavors. although i am a big fan of sweet chocolate outsidie of a glass of beer, i prefer what is going on here when discussing whats in my glass. that not very sweet chocolate really compliments the other flavors. the caramel comes out with stronger coffee notes as it warms too. just what i was hoping for.
Pours a jet black with almost no head. Taste is fizzier than I would have expected and a touch off putting. The flavor is smooth and balance. Nice tobacco and boot leather body.
Bomber bottled 11/24/14. Dark brown, minimal head. Aroma is roast. Bittersweet chocolate chips. Slight mocha coffee. Lighter body for a dark beer. Decent for a light porter.

Can brought back from Florida by my girlfriend. Poured from the 12oz can with a very dark brown body and a small tan head. Aroma was some chocolate notes, some sweet bittersweet notes, some burnt character. An interesting flavor, not sure if I dug it as much as I was hoping.

Bottle care of the Sipper. It pours near black with a medium tan head. The nose is soft, juicy, plenty of cocoa, earth, toast and earth. The taste is bitter-sweet, toasty, milk chocolate, roasted malt, earth, toffee and raisin with a smooth finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Sweet, smooth and chocolatey. Easy-going stuff.

Had on nitro at the brewery. Pours a dark, dark brown with creamy ivory head. Chocolate, caramel, and a hint of toffee on the nose, just a little sweetness; follows onto the palate. Finishes with notes of roasted malt. Very nice.
Shared bottle at CBC Clerkenwell, cocoa nose and dry choco-gravy body, lightly creamy.

Bottle shared at CBC Clerkenwell - thanks to Jaques. Pours red-brown with a tan cream head. The nose holds lots of toasted cereal and dusty cocoa. Medium sweet flavor with dry chocolate, light chocolate, some mild earthy bitterness, hints of dried fruits. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. More toasted cereal and cocoa on the finish. Straightforward but very, very drinkable.
Dark pour, notes of coffee and chocolate on nose. Taste follows with some caramel. Perfect hop bite with medium carbonation. Great porter.
bottle. Terrific porter. Awesome flavor and perfect beer during the holidays,
Bottle - Pours cola with a filmy tan head. Nose is dry chocolate and a bit of graham cracker, and a touch of milk. Taste is dry, ashy roast, charcoal and a little milk. Thin body and very bubbly.

Poured from bottle into a pint glass: Pours dark brown / black with a thin tan head. Aroma of chocolate, caramel, cinnamon, and cracker malts. Taste is heavy chocolate, toffee, and roasted malt. A little sweet, a little bitter. Heavy body, sticky mouthfeel, light carbonation. This is a really nice porter.

Bottle thanks to the best Homer! Pours a dark chocolate color with a small off-white head. A roast, coffee and dark fruit nose. Dark fruit, cocoa, a hint of sourness akin to the Baltic Porter from Duck Rabbit, heavy roast, lactose, milky coffee. This is a really big beer for 6.5%. Burnt wood. Excellent. The metallic sour roast is just perfect for me.
22 ounce Bomer bottle at the Riverside market for is a deep jet black with a twinge of red. Nicely balanced very nice drinking porter.
Wow. This is an outstanding porter. Great balance. Good complexity. Hops in moderation.

Can. Deep opaque brown body with orange-red highlights at the margins, medium clumping cream head with nice lacing. Rich nose of roasted malts, charred sugars, chocolate and coffee. Full, dense, rich body, creamy and deliciously sweet with toasted sugars, chocolate, roast, marshmallows, and light coffee bean. Great interplay of sweet and bitter notes. Very good.
12oz can pours a dark brown color with a lot of head. Mild burnt malt flavors and a nice balance of hops.

Lots of chocolate, and more caramel than most porters. I thought it was too sweet, with the roasty bitterness only coming through in the finish. More hop flavor up-front would have given it better balance. Medium-bodied. Good but not great.

Dark beer with a foamy beige head out of the can. Really rich, inviting roast grain and caramel sugar nose. This is a very nice porter, all the way to the bottom of the glass. Rich roasted malts, dark caramel, dried fruits, a hint of smoke and ash, and a hint of bitter hops as it dries out in the finish. Very nice porter.

Tasted on 9/9/14 from a 12oz can sent to me as an extra in a trade. Pours opaque, nearly black dark brown with a thick, rocky beige head that slowly recedes to thick, uneven, and messy lace. The nose is dry mocha, plenty of dark chocolate and coffee, with just a touch of toffee, nuts, and caramel. The flavor is caramel and toffee malt up front, moving to the nuts, dark chocolate and nicely bitter roasted coffee and toasted nibs. The body is a bit fuller than average with fairly lively carbonation and a long lightly charred, bitter roasted nutty coffee and very dry dark chocolate finish.

first off, i want to seriously want to beat the dog on the can with piece of rebar .. . nice rich mouth feel .. . dark brown .. all in line and a great american porter. a good dog i suppose .. . . and a dogs breath has never smelled like chocolate & coffee, ever- more like balls and butthole...

Pours pitch black with a large tan head. Smells chocolatey with a hint of roast. Taste is chocolate with roast and a hint of coffee. Medium-bodied with smooth texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Cigar City Puppys Breath Robust Porter finishes with a lingering chocolate note.

With Z, pours a dark mahogany brown with a creamy java head. Nose is deep chocolate malt with some mocha breaking through as well. Taste is toffee, heavy malt and bittersweet chocolate. Finish is heavy and ends on the same tasting note with a long bitter hoppy ending. Nice porter. Quaff Score 8 / 10

Can. Pours a muddy brown with a brown head and aroma of sweet chocolate and roasted malt. Taste is delicious, lots of sweet chocolate and roasted malt with coffee, toffee and caramel flavors into the burnt, chocolaty finish with some hoppy bitterness. Very flavorful porter
Can from Jeff. Pours a dark brown with a thin layer of tan head. Aroma of toasted malts and coffee. Taste pretty much the same.

12 ounce can from Secret Santa. Thanks! Opened 8/3/14. This one appears to have seeped through the can lid. Pours a dark brown color with a frothy tan head. Good head retention. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, dark chocolate, coffee, nuts, dark fruits. The taste is nuts, chocolate, roasted malts, dark fruits, bitter coffee finish. Thin-medium bodied, slight lingering bitterness. Solid.

Can courtesy of Homer321, thanks again! Dark brown pour with a tan head. Aromas of roasted coffee with notes of cocoa. Flavor is sweet malts upfront with lots of roasty goodness going on. Coffee and chocolate in the finish. Delicious and smooth. Very good.

Not as much coffee as i was expecting. Balance beer for sure. I tried it salt iced chilled in a mug initially..not much difference that straight feom the can. A good beer for sure but i preferred the cuban expresso.

12oz can to snifter. Dark pour. As dark brown as brown can be without being black. Huge creamy light tan head. Aroma is sweet malt and slight nutty coffee. Huge roasty flavor with a very bitter charred finish but sweet up front.
Very nice dark brown apparent body. Dark chocolate flavors. Goes down easy but leaves the mouth with ton of flavor.

12 oz. can thanks going to Rightcross55 for the chance to try it. Dark brown borderline black with lasting head. Aroma is smoky malt, chocolate, burnt ash, light roasted coffee notes. 
Flavor has a good layer of depth. Rich malts give the flavors from the aroma with a solid medium roasted body. Creamy texture on the tongue with traces of ash. Lots of lingering roast. Great example of the style.
Can. Pours a dark brown with beige head that lasts. The aroma is toffee and caramel. Thin mouthfeel with rich roasted malt, bitter chocolate and caramel. Easy to drink, good.

On tap at Cambridge for PBW. Pours a dark brown color with a caramel colored head. Aromas of roast, caramel, and some chocolate. Sweet roasty caramel taste with some chocolate mixed in. Just solid and true to the style.
Draft. Black pour with tan head. Roasted, chocolate, caramel aromas. Flavors are sweet chocolate and caramel, some roasted dry finish.
Dark brown with a big healthy brown head. Aroma of chocolate and roasted grain. Taste is chocolate, sweet malt, and smooth vanilla. Very good for the style.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2014 On tap, pours black with cookies and cream looking head. Awesome lacing. Aromas are toffee, roasted grain, chocolate, and nuts. Flavor is milk chocolate, roasted malt, light char, barrel, and molasses pops. Easy drinking porter.

Dark pour with deep garnet highlights running through. Powerful aroma of dark coffee and chocolate. Chocolate runs down the center of the tounge with coffee biting at the sides. Dark break laying underneath it all. Starting to be chewy but in a velvety kind of way. No real alcohol burn, no metallic tang from the can.

Can thanks to Homer! Pours clear ruby black, large creamy brown head, dissipates slowly, nice lacing. Aroma is roasty, ashtray, toffee, coffee - right up the middle of the porter fairway. Flavor is the same, light sweet, light bitter, coffee, ashtray. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Very nice standard porter.

can. pours black with a 1/4" off white head. chocolate, coffee and roasted dark malt aromas. med to full body with deep caramel, coffee, chocolate, dark fruits, burnt coffee, toffee and roasted malt flavors - many layers - complex porter. round mouthfeel with a nice bitterness. crisp finish with the hop bitterness coming through more along with the supporting roast. excellent porter - one of the best Ive ever had for sure.

12oz can gifted by Toby. Thanks buddy. Poured dark brown with a 1/2" off white head with great retention and nice lacing. Nose is bittersweet chocolate and heavy roasted malts. Taste is similar to the nose with some the roasted malts really be the most prominent.

12oz can via trade with newcigarz, thanks Tony. Poured a good looking medium density black body with an average sized thick foamy beige body with some solid lasting lacing. Aroma is super roasty, chocolate, cream, medium dark toast, nut shells. Nice palate, medium body, lingering aftertaste, average carbonation, dry overall yet a touch of sweetness on the back side. Flavor is like the aroma, roasty, burnt malts, dark toast, dark chocolate, coffee. Really good stuff.
Really nice porter. Pleasant toasty aroma with a nice little bite. Pretty smooth on the tongue too.
Draft. Deep, dark brown with light brown head. Excellent lacing. Aroma is very roasty, coffee. Some lacto type sweetness. A little roasty in the flavor. Overall pretty solid.

Dark brown, mildly translucent pour with large tan head. Big chocolate aroma, milk chocolate, roast, grainy, mild sweetness. Quite a bit of roast up front in the flavor followed by notes of chocolate and a mild bitterness in the finish. Medium-high mouthfeel.
Draft pint at the Mack House bar in Davie, FL for $6.00 5/6/14. Very good!
Draft - Bitter chocolate, toffee and a little cedar. Jet black with a rich light brown head. Cedar and bitter chocolate. Not sure why I get cedar, but it seems to be in lots of their beers.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2015 Enjoyed a pint of this beer on tap at the brewpub. The beer had a thick black appearance with a good-sized creamy off-white head with good retention, and great lacing and cling. It had a roasty aroma with strong notes of chocolate, toffee, and caramel, along with bits of coffee, and some earthy scents as well. It had a sweet chocolate and toffee taste with touches of coffee and caramel, along with some mildly bitter earthy flavors. it was a wet and creamy beer with a thicker and filling mouthfeel, along with average carbonation and life.

Can from hopscotch - thanks! Wow, this is one of the best porters Ive ever had. Black as night pour with a big pillowy beige head. Nice rich roasty and chocolate nose. Hints of toffee. Full palate. Absolutely delicious!

Can shared by b3shine. Poured a dark brown color with an average frothy light brown head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy toasted dark chocolate malt aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy toasted dark malt sweet flavor with a medium complex dark malt sweet finish of moderate to long duration. Solid complex brew.
Mélasse, chocolat noir, houblons verts dans un corps aminci et teinté dalcool.

12oz can, thanks to b3shine for sharing. Dark brown color, with a good thin tan head. Leaves respectable ropes and bits of lace. Whoa... Nice nose on this one. Dark chocolate, coffee. Moderate bigger bitter taste, light sweet. Smooth, lightly soft, lighter carbonation. Medium to bigger body. Lightly dry finish. Good chewiness to the texture. Great chocolate and cocoa nib in the flavor, good moderate coffee. Nice roast malt. Fantastic, flavorful porter!

Can @ home. Thanks, Sean. Very dark brown pour with a tall tan head. Roasted malt, licorice, chocolate, and a hint of ash. Slight caramel and herbal hops. Flavor is pleasantly bitter with a nice sweet chocolate and molasses balance. Roasted malt, lots of licorice, and a touch of char/ash. Light herbal and earthy hops. Lightly smokey as it sits.

At place with Taylor, Taren, and Justin. Pours black brown a circle of lace. Aroma is complex medium chocolate, roasted vanilla, light. Taste is complex chocolate malt, very flavorful, but very drinkable, the perfect combo for a porter, marshmallow. Nice.

Another 12oz can extra received in a great trade with madnismo... Shared with the usual suspects..... Thanks Nathan!

Pours a pretty standard black with hints of garnet escaping from the stem end of my glass... long lasting dark tan head with good sheets of lacing.

Nose is exactly what I expected... nearly perfect bigger porter... sweeter/nutty/bittersweet chocolate.

Flavor mirrors the nose with a drier (than the aroma) palate... still a nice bittersweet chocolate essence... fermented out caramel/toffee... a bit of darker malt with warmth.

Body does not make me think 8%.. surprisingly drinkable.

I really liked this one and normally dont appreciate standard porters.

12oz can thanks to Toby. Pours out a brown with some red highlights topped with a tan head. Nose is fresh roast coffee malts and some hop notes. Taste is as the nose with lots of coffee a nice roast. Pretty tasty.
Love this porter. Pours dark brown tan head. Toffee char aroma. Some roastiness, coffee, chocolate and toffee flavors. Silky light body light carbonation for a creamy mouth feel. Good stuff.
More coffee than chocolate. Nice foam and an attractive aroma leads into a smooth but bitter flavor of ground coffee and toasted bread. Finish stays longer than needed. Too bitter for my taste.
On tap at the brewery. Comes a very dark brown with a decent tan head. Aroma of malt, chocolate, and coffee. Taste is roasted malt, semi-sweet chocolate, coffee, caramel, and vanilla. Very nice.

I was apprehensive at first, due to the name, but up for a unique flavor. The story written on the can about puppies breath didnt assuage my apprehension. Theyre really going for a puppys breath.

As I think about it, I bet that they were tasting this beer after a few beers, and someone jokingly said that it tasted like a puppys breath, so they went with it. Another reason to love Cigar City.

Pours dark and rich, thin but tenacious head - perfect head for this beer.

Taste is malty, cocoa,and caramel. Hops are mild and balanced. Slightly sweeter than what Id typically drink, but they did it right.

Black pour, light tan head. Nose is roasted malts, light cocoa, somewhat vegetal. Taste is roasted malts, a touch of stale coffee, chocolate, vegetal, aluminum. Thin sticky mouthfeel. I like this much more on nitro.
Had on nitro at the Brewery. Pours dark with a nice full head. Aroma is of a standard chocolate porter. Tastes great, very smooth.
Had on nitro at Oblivion. Pours dark with a nice full head. Aroma is of a standard chocolate porter. Tastes great, very smooth.

Nitro at Oblivion Taproom. Aromas of roast coffee and sweet chocolate. Taste is smooth roasted malt with a bitter hop presence that plays nice with the dark chocolate sweetness. Creamy and smooth finish. Really good.

On nitro at Brass Tap. Pours black with a medium creamy light tan head. Aroma is molasses like with some grains in the background. Taste is heavy roasted malts balanced well with some hoppy bitterness. Sweetness comes out in the mid and blends well with the other flavors. Finish is mildly bitter. Smooth overall.
Tap at the brewpub... Deep brown... Thick tan head.... Soft chocolate roast dark malt nose... Sift toffee roast... Dark sweet malts... Light chocolate

Poured from a tap. Dark brown color, long lived creamy tan head. Slight sour mash and malt aroma. Medium sour and charred malt flavor with a full body and creamy texture.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black pour with a persistent light tan head. Nose has a bit of roast and cocoa in it, with some very light coffee notes. Flavor is sweet and a little roasty with some dark bakers cocoa and a mild earthy sweetness, a touch of light citric coffee, and a semi-dry cocoa-ish finish. Pretty swell.

Draft in a snifter. Pours a jet black with a thin white head. Great little lacing around the rim. Aroma of dark chocolate, cocoa nibs, vanilla and roasted malts. Taste is the same with a little dark coffee and cocoa. Finishes dry and clean. No aftertaste. Another fine beer from CCB.

Nitro on tap at Tampa International. Pours a dark brown with a guinness like head, very thick and creamy. The aroma is very full of dark roasted sweet malts, wood scents, toffee, and a weak but pleasant hop aroma. In tasting I caught carmel, butter, slight bittering chocolate, and a pleasant roasty malt flavor. The finish is a weak bitter, rich in cooked malts, and with a touch of dryness. Overall a fine porter, very enjoyable.

[The ABV for Puppy's Breath Porter is now 6% in both cans and on tap at the tasting room. Previously, "Puppy's Breath Robust Porter" came in at 8%. Perhaps "Puppy's Breath Porter" and "Puppy's Breath Robust Porter" should be listed as separate beers.]

On nitro 4 oz. sampler at the Cigar City Brewing tasting room in Tampa, FL. 

Opaque, black-brown with a creamy tan head and excellent lacing. 

Aroma of coffee, charcoal, roasted malt, toffee and molasses. 

Taste of chocolate, coffee, molasses, RN, toffee and charcoal. 

Medium/full body and low carbonization with a soft nitro mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2014 First ratingSampled on January 20, 2014. Draught, at Tarpon Tavern, Tarpon Springs, FL.As "Nitro Porter".Black color, dense tan head. Sweet, malty, rich scent. Sweet, rich, malty, roasted taste. Bitter, roasted aftertaste. Medium to smooth mouthfeel, medium high bitterness.8/4/8/3/15=3.8RerateDraugh at Cigar City (brewery location) on January 24, 2014.Black color, tan head. SWeet, malty scent. Roasted, malty, sweet taste. Smooth mouthfeel, medium high bitterness. Very nice!8/4/8/4/16=4.0

UPDATED: APR 10, 2014 Inky. Aroma is fresh-shaved ceder or mahogany luon and roast. Mouthy, rich. Need to re-rate when Im not socializing. On tap @ the drowland-Tallahassee Winter Homecoming 2014 @ Proof.


Re-rate, additional comments: Can.  Cute fella on the label.  Clear, deep black-brown.  Big tan head.  Im picking up more creosote in the aroma.  Smooth, coffee and woody.  Medium to slightly light (surprisingly) body.  Good.  Very drinkable.  New Leaf Market.

Tallahassee, Fl - Proof Brewing - on tap. Dark brown pour, thick khaki colored head - nice lacing. Woody, cedar-like aroma like walking into a humidor, hints of chocolate. Flavor is full bodied and robust with some oak-like woody notes, some pipe tobacco notes, chocolate permeates throughout. Nice thick, rich mouthfeel. Very enjoyable.

My Bottom Line:
Vanilla and roasted coffee beans both come out of this Porters sweet flavour profile, lasting nicely well after the sip is finished.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A creamy slab of foam tops the darkness.
-Mouthfeel is obviously quite smooth due to the nitrogen treatment, which works quite well with the level of residual sugars.
-Earthy hop resins balance out the finish.
-This is a very nice Porter for dessert lovers.

 On tap (nitro) at the brewery taproom.

On nitro, which is always a good thing. Pretty decent porter, and glad this will be part if regular production soon. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On nitro at CCB. Pours a moderate black, with the typical creamy nitro head. Mouthfeel was excellent (I'm a fan of nitro), with a smooth creaminess and perfect carbonation. This beer takes really well to the nitro treatment. The flavor itself was solid, if unspectacular. Strong roastiness and above average bitterness dominates, with not much in the way of sweetness. I'd prefer a bit more of a balance here but the beer is still quite strong. Technically well-executed. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

20th July 2011Opaque black beer with a decent fluffy tan head. Mild lactose malt nose with a trace of coffee. Smooth palate with modest fine carbonation. Light. Mild dark malt with no bitterness but there is nice undertone of mild roast. Traces of lactose and coffee. Minerals and brief glimpse of red berry fruits. Finishes with mild hop bitterness and a mildly bitter aftertaste. Nice to see CCB could do the basics as well as the spectacular.

Snifter pour, deep dark and healthy with a full finger of off white head. Nose is smooth roasted malts, chocolate, toasty and lightly sweetened. Flavor is roasted up front with noticeable coffee, caramel sweetness in the end. Really a great porter. Good lacing throughout.

pours jet black with an off white head. Aroma of roast, chocolate and a hint of hops. taste follows, thick and chocolately with some coffee.  Very chewy, like a chocolate beer brownie with a touch of coffee

Draft to a unique shaped pint at Pegs. Looks good; an opaque brown with sticky  beige lacing. Smells and tastes malty and a little roasty with something else I cant put my finger on. Some hops in there too. Good on the palate too. Different, but good.
Had this on tap at proof brewing.  Found it to be solid with a nice roastiness and medium body.  Good overall porter.

Draft. Black pour, small tan head, little retention/some lace. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, pine, roast, licorice. Taste is coffee, chocolate, light hop bitterness, roast. Palate is soft, slick, roast finish. I think Jose Marti porter is the better of these two.

Its back on tap and hopefully here to stay. Pours a thick brownish-black on tap with frothy tan head and moderate lacing. Aroma of coffee, roasted and toasted malts, slight bitter chocolate. Taste follows with great lingering coffee flavor and slight piney back end. Really good porter that is surprisingly easy to drink for the abv.

On tap @proofbrewing. Aroma is coffee, cocoa, toffee. Mouthful is medium bodied, light chocolate notes with a coffee finish. Other flavors on the palate are some idistinguishable dark fruit flavors, maybe even cherry. All in all a very smooth but bold porter, amazing name aside, awesome brew.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2014 Pours dark opaque brown with minimal head. Smell of hige coffee. Heavy coffee flavor with chocolate finish. Medium mouthfeel. 

Revisiting this one now that its on cans. Pours dark brown essentially black in my glass with a big creamy looking khaki or off white head that sticks around. Aroma is some light roastiness , a bit of chocolate, hint of fruit, maybe a bit of dry balancing hops. Flavor follows with mellow roast, some dark chocolate, and finishing with some sweet dark fruits like prunes and raisins. Very very nice. Mouthfeel is big and rich for the style, with medium carbonation. This is one of my favorite porters out there, ahead of Black Butte, Founders, and Ed Fitz. Yum.

Entering old rates. Draft @ CCB
Couleur brune foncée, laissant un col épais entre blanc cassé et moka. Arôme est complexe sur des notes profondes de chocolat, malt, grillé avec une pointe de cacao en poudre. Palais est également aussi bien fourni avec une longueur de bouche sur la chocolaté et malté, le tout complété par une brève amertume houblonnée. Le tout reste assez pointu en alcool, mais très facile à boire.

Nitro sample at the tap room. Pours a murky dark brown color with a medium creamy off-white head that diminishes slowly. Patchy lacing on the glass. Roasted malt, chocolate and hops in the nose. Medium, smooth body with a roasty character and notes of chocolate malt, coffee and hops. The finish is malty with a sweet vanilla coffee aftertaste. Good overall.

On tap at the brewery. Although its labelled as "robust," I didnt get much in the nose. Some mild chocolate, maybe a bit of red wine. Very dark brown, no head, a little lace. Chocolate, toffee flavors, with some raisin and plum. Thin-medium body. Not really so special. Does hide the alc. well.
Tap at Rattle N Hum.  Pours like cola with a foamy off white head.  Aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, cocoa.  Coffee, chocolate and butterscotch.  I like.

On tap at RnH.  Espresso brown color with a large off-white head.  Aroma included strong notes of bitter sweet chocolate, caramel, and hints of smoke.  First sip introduced chocolate and toffee followed by palatable hop bitterness.  Great mouthfeel and the sweetness and bitterness dance on the palate long after each sip.  Magnificently crafted porter that is a pleasure to drink.
Dark with beige head.  Aroma is roasted malts, cocoa, and burnt malt. Full bodied. Flavor was thick with roasted and lightly burnt malt, cocoa, light hop character, molasses. Good beer.
Draft at the source. Almost black, tan head, great lacing. Aroma actually conjures up the name, and Im sober. Also has milk chocolate and perfume. Taste is lilacs and cocoa. Very nice.

Tap at CCB. Thick beige lace atop deep deep ruby. Complete 360 lace. Nose is grapefruit hoppy. Taste is resinous, rich chocolate, licorice, mild anise seed. Caraway seed. Sharply herbal. Thicker palate. Interesting. Thick and filling. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft at cigar city wIth Linh. Pours a dark brown with thin brown lacing. Aroma is light lactose. Mouthfeel is thin with notes of roast, milk and a light hop character.

Pours dark ch. Brown. Tan head which disapates by third SIP. Light lace. Earthy nose with a hint if citrus. Malty sweetness but not syrupy. Creamy mouthfeel that develops a tingle with slight heat and peppery tone. Sweet dark chocolate, coffee with a slight tart Orange zest hoppines. Earthy but very sessionable. Cheers!

A dark brown porter with a thin lacing and frothy mocha head, In aroma, a grassy bitter chocolate with dark fruits, musty coffee, not bad. In mouth, a nice sweet musty chocolate, burned toffee, grassy and smooth. On tap at Prohibition Pig, March 12, 2012.

On tap in the CCB taste room.

Dark black pour. No head. Not much aroma to speak of right away. A semi thick beer. Some light chocolate and coffee notes from start to finish. Lots of roasty characters on the back end.

Pours a deep brown with a creamy khaki colored head. Nose is lots a deep roasted malts, caramel and coffee. Flavor presents deep roasted malts, some coffee, light hop spice and chocolate. Finishes slightly bitter and medium to full bodied. Pretty tasty.

Name: Puppys Breath Porter
Date: October 01, 2010
Mode: Bottle
Source: Tasting
Appearance: dark brown, fine beige head
Aroma: rich dry chocolate aroma, touch of spicyness
Flavor: rich chocolate flavor, hint of caramel sweetness, roasted comes in a second wave
Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 12/20
Rating: 3/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: ** /4

This poured a medium to dark brown color with a beige head. Aroma was a nice combination of roast/chocolate and fruity bittering hops. Flavor was nice and hoppy for a porter, while still having a nice dark roast underneath. I really liked this one.
Tap at brewery and robust indeed.  Chocolate, ash, vanilla, fruity, and bitter.  Very flavorful and warming on finish.  Yum

64oz. Growler:  Got in trade.  Aroma of malt, roasting, chocolate, slight vanilla, light coffee, and some lactose.  Poured very dark brown/ruby/mahogany in color with a medium-sized, creamy, dense, tan/brown head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Clear.  Likely sparkling.  Very good lacing.  Flavor is medium sweet and lightly bitter.  Tastes of malt, roasting, coffee, chocolate, and some lactose.  Medium body.  Lightly sticky texture.  Average carbonation.  Malt, roast, coffee, chocolate, lactose finish is lightly sticky and lightly dry.  8%ABV is completely hidden throughout.
very robust aroma. pours a beautiful black with creamy white head. very high alc but cant taste it extremly smoth and roasty/burnt flavor. thanks meadme:)
4 oz sampler / pour at Cigar City tasting room....excellent traditional porter - rich, dark nose and initial taste....excellent....big dark and rich...

Respectfully handbottled by Ibrew2or3, thanks man. Pours a clear and dark brown with a weak beige head. The aroma is malt, roasted, coffee, liquorice and ash. The flavor follows the nose. The palate is dry. Overall a good beer.

Growler courtesy of ernesto987!  Love the cigar city dark beer malts.  Very nutty, roasty, and robust with a very light bitterness at the end.  Notes of milk chocolate, espresso, and toast.  One of my favorite porters.
growler, very roasted. Thick body, great roasty aroma. SLAM DUCK BITCHES! great finish, this is awesome

Growler by OmegaX - nice! The pour is a nice bubbly brown with a presentable head for a porter. Smells a bit like fresh mowed grass and aged chocolate. Flavors of chocolate, hops and a full-earthy taste surround the palate in layers of delectable, mellow notes. Finishes dry and a little bitter, JUST leaving behind a nice dark chocolate aftertaste. Very nice.

Pours black with thin tan head.  Aroma is roasted malts and a little sweetness.  Taste is caramel and roasted malts, a little smokiness, and definitely some chocolate on the end.  Full-bodied palate.  Great representation of the style...wow.

Review from notes at World of Beer - Fort Myers on 9/29/11. 

Poured on draft into a snifter. 

Appearance: Pours a cola brown, almost black, with a 1 finger creamy light tan head. Excellent lacing.

Smell: Sweet and roasted malt with a touch of chocolate.

Taste: Fruity bitterness and roasted malt up front followed by chocolate in the middle before ending with hoppy bitterness and sweet malt at the finish. Aftertaste is bittersweet. Definitive CCB flavor comes through.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied with a decent amount of carbonation.

Drinkability: Very good drinkability. The elevated ABV% would keep you from drinking multiples, but the flavor is very good.

Overall: Very good beer overall. This isnt your typical porter, so its more closely related to an imperial stout. Definitely try this one if you get the chance.
Handbottled, provided by stobbe74, thanks. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is roasted male, coffee and chocolate. Flavour is sweet roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and liquorish.

32oz growler courtesy of my good buddy ibrew2or3. thanks, dave! i obviously had to have this one given my love for dogs. crushed this with my 110lb yellow lab/golden mix, Oakley, sitting at my side. pours a deep, dark, cola brown with a thick, creamy, khaki head that leaves sticky rings of lace. aroma is fantastic with rich notes of toasted malts, hazelnut coffee, milk chocolate, and caramel up front backed by notes of fruity trail mix, oatmeal, and a touch of smoked wood. flavor is simply wonderful with rich, roasted coffee, candied pecans, toasted wheat bread, and chocolate-covered black cherries up front backed by dry wood, leafy tobacco, and roasted malts with hints of herbal hops and dry, salty peanuts on the back end. palate is smooth and medium bodied with perfect carbonation and a lingering, roasted, nutty finish. overall, a marvelous porter.
Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of cocoa and coffee. Nice malty chocolaty flavor with a milky texture. Not an exceptional porter but still very good.

Appearance: blackened browns under a voluminous tan head both velveteen and mousse-like. Fades in the shape of a doughnut. Swirls with a 360* collar and more smooth puff.

Nose: roasted and dry. Brittle chocolates, earth, dirt, wood, espresso beans. Tobacco and cigar leaf earthy and spicy. Used wood barrels. Black root. Mexican coffee. Dried leaves in the back.

Palate: malted milk balls with malt powder in back. Wisps of tartness in with the meaty dark fruits, craggy roots, and fresh tobacco leaf. Finishes dry and woodsy. Creamy mouthfeel is quite pleasurable. Black root and licorice in the middle. Dark fruits in the breath.

Final Thoughts: intriguingly complex, far more than I was expecting upon venturing in. Easily a good cigar beer but even if cigars arent your thing, having a Puppys Breath Porter is always a good and tasteful idea.
Dark brown pour. Tan head. Roasty aroma w cocoa, charred wood and a lactose sweetness. Flavor is lightly sweet, roast, cocoa. Awesome porter.

Draft at Coffee District on a day way too hot to have a porter. Dark brown pour with a thin tan head. Scent is chocolate, coffee and lightly roasted. Taste is coffee and roasty with dark chocolate notes. Light sweet finish.

Growler... Light black with the biggest head Ive seen from a growler, at least eight fingers of light tan head, great retention and lacing... Nose and taste and light chocolate, almost perfect porter

Growler in a trade

thanks go out to a generous Florida trader for the unique 32 ounce growler that contained an amazing porter. Sometimes I wonder if Cigar City lives up to the hype but in this case the answer is yes. I can only hope that the Oatmeal Raisin Cookie is just as good. If it wasnt before Cigar City is now a must visit on any trip to Florida.

Aroma and appearance - Fluid and inky the body is murky like oily water. The light beige head was a soft accent. Sweet bakers chocolate, iced coffee, and fresh raspberries bite at the edge of the senses. Dark fruits and slightly overdone pie crust add a bit more depth.

Flavor and palate - Full bodied and rich the mouthfeel is strong for the style. Like frozen coffee cubes the beer melts in the mouth. Malt, bakers chocolate, coffee, and toasted white bread left a little too long in the toaster create an impression on the palate. Somehow though it is not overwhelming. Instead it strikes the perfect balance between depth and delicacy that makes it possible to polish off the growler without any troubles. Hats off to Cigar City for another home run.

Handbollte provided by Stobbe74, thanks. Dark brown body with a tiny offwhite head. Aroma is chocolate, roasted malt, liquorice smokey notes. Flavor is bitter chocolate, roasted malt, notes of alcohol. Waterish palate. Nice beer though.
Pours a dark brown with little head aromas of chocolate and sweet malt.  Flavors of chocolate, malt and a hint of spice, a really good beer, it sucks that is no longer on tap.

Thanks stobbe! Black with a lasting tan head. Aroma of chocolate with some interesting floral and spicy notes. Sweet chocolate and roasted malt flavour. >Well brewed but pretty simple porter with suprisingly much alcohol compared to the flavour and complexity
Bottle @ Odense Summer Tasting, 2011. Handbottled.  Pours black with a creamy off white head. Nose is ashes, roast , liquorice and honey. Smooth and full bodied.  Tasty.
On tap from the brewery - brought up by Wilkes and Lynn.  Roasted nuts and cocoa in the aroma.  Tastes are coffee, vanilla, cocoa, and caramel sweetness.  Slick drinkable palate.
Draft at WOB.  Pours a very dark brown with a touch of red around the edges.  Dark roasted malt and coffee aroma.  Wonderful flavor with just the right amount of bitterness in the finish.
Great heavy roast smell. Drinks lighter than appears has a slight tootsie roll after taste kinda with that sweet tart chocolatey tastes.

Growler again. Creamy smooth with a little more roasti bittersweet aspect for a porter. A bit quick on the finish but nice milk chocolate. Get a bit of semi sweetness on the back end. This part does leave a little lip sticking sort of flavor for a bit.

On tap 07/09/11 @ the Lucky Pelican Bistro & Fish Market in Sarasota, Fl. Pours a coffee black with a medium tan head that leaves excellent lacing. Chocolate aroma has hints of cocoa and coffee. Rich malty flavor has hints of roasted coffee and chocolate that has a smooth and creamy mouthfeel leading into a dry cocoa finish. Very delicious and WOW! I was glad I hit happy hour for 2 for 1.

Body was nice and pitch black with a tan colored head. Good lacing, too. Aromas of chocolate, roast, coffee, and malts. Intense for a porter. Same with the flavors. Nice and chocolatey up front with an intense roasted coffee flavor on the end. Nice bitterness on the finish too. Like a dry cocoa. Excellent.

Growler thanks to 50belair. A dark brown almost black beer with a good head. The aroma is nice with dark fruits, cola, roast, coffee, and chocolate. A very nice aroma. The taste is very nice also with some chocolate malt and almost like roasted coffee, and some smoke. Damn this is an outstanding porter. i really enjoyed this down to the last drop and may be the best porter Ive ever had.

Mini Growler - thanks to Hopscotch for this one. Shared with Ratman. Dark rich pour with nice lacing, Nose of chocolate and espresso.  Offers up a tasty maltiness, with a dusty? / dry ? coffee and molasses character. Finishes a bit bitter but still nice overall. Liked this beer. .

Dark brown pour with a layer of bubbly tan head... decent lacing left around the glass.

Aroma is primarily smokey with a bit of maltiness also coming through.  Flavor follows the nose closely, but overall this is very drinkable considering relatively high ABV. Nice smooth mouthfeel.  Id definitely drink this one again...

Opaque mohagany, thin beige head, creamy full body, medium carbonation.

Aroma: semi-sweet chocolate, stale coffee, bready fruity yeast esters.

Taste: semi-sweet chocolate, dark roasted malt, stale coffee, musty yeast esters, and a hint of charred malt.

Perfect baltic porter! Great complex malt flavors. Balanced, but malt focused. Full and flavorful with a lot of dark malt character, but not the charr or astringency of RIS.

32 oz growler from Tampa...It pours dark medium thick black with a small head. It smells very roasty, smoky, and notes of coffee. The commplex flavors are of dark chocolate, slight coffee, and roasty malts blend well on the tongue.

Tampa Weekly Gathering @BT WesleyChapel-on tap-pours a rich brown head and black color.  Aroma is rich dark malt-ashy/wood/chickory, some jalepeno sharpness.  Taste is rich dark malt-ashy/wood/chickory, some jalepeno sharpness.  Smooth.

32 oz. growler from smith4498- thanks again, Jason!  Pours a cloudy brown color with a small beige head.  Aroma of mild coffee, toast, roasted caramel malts, smoked wood, chocolate, and grass.  Flavor stays along those lines pretty closely, with a little cream to add to the coffee.  Good complexity for a porter.  Medium-bodied, with mild carbonation and a roasty mouthfeel.  Very nice.
growler shared by phaleslu at WLV liquors pig roast.   aroma of cold coffee, herbal, grassy bitter milky chocolate.  some light roast.   milky.  slick, mouthfeel.   pretty good stuff.   thanks peter!

Growler thanks to Doodler poured a clear dark brown with a smalllingering brown head. Aromas of bitter chocolate, roastiness, coffee, light licorice and a hint of vanilla. Palate was medium bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of bitter chocolate, roastiness, light coffee and hints of licorice and vanilla with a smooth dry lingering roasty finish.

On draft at Coffee District.  Dark brown with a creamy beige head.  A nutty almost coffee like aroma with hints of chocolate, cola and smoke.  Flavor has plenty of roasted malts with nuts and caramel.  The hops arent totally hidden which I really liked.  Smooth dry finish.  One of the best "straight" porters Ive had.

On draft at Coffee District for Cigar City night 10/7/10. Im partial towards porters and stouts, so this one was a must have for me. The color was dark brown, maybe even a little muddy,  but with a nice thick head to it. The aromas were big and bold. A lot  of  chocolate and nuts in there, along  with dark malts as well. The taste was very pleasant, with roasted nut flavors. Carbonation was good,  as was  head retention.

Black color/ tan head. Big dark chocolate fudge, medium roast malt aromas. Rich, smooth mouthfeel. Great flavors of rich malted chocolate, roasty malt, mild coffee, drys up a bit for the finish. very good shit. @ CCB 10.01.2010
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Growler shared bu DuffManSW. Rating# 33. Super dark brown, almost black with a nice tan head. Aroma is a bit roasty, light smoke. Very smooth, nice mouthfeel. Flavor is very roasty, more light smoke and a nice little ash flavor in there as well, pretty good shit, thanks for sharing Sean. (1409)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Growler thanks to hopscotch....dark dark brown pour with a tan head...Roasty aroma, slightly sweet....Flavor is roasty with a slight ash finish...Very tasty. Thanks Eric

draft @ redlight redlight.  Bitter chocolate and coffee on the nose, solid roasted malt character.  Pours black with a dense tan head, nice lacing.  Bitter coffee with molasses and piney hops, nice roasted malt character with a somewhat heavy hand of bitter hops.  Nice!

CCB Mini Growler sent to me by Matt (50belair), thanks a lot, Rating #4600 Pours a deep brown with ruby highlights with a nice creamy beige and very nice lacework upon my NB Worthy glassware. The aroma has notes of roasted and smoky malts, some chocolate, espresso, leather, tobacco, walnut, oats, and a hint of black cherry esters and grassy hops. The taste starts with solid toasted and charred malts before snappy hop and espresso-like bitterness comes around to smack the palate. Some chocolate covered nuts, molasses and anise tones as well. The finish is a tad ashy and boozy. This taste is more a bit similar to my homebrew Robust Porter but with a tad more chocolate and tobacco with a tad less bitterness and no oak. The initial impression reminded me enough that I had to open my HB to taste them side by side... eerie!  Aggressive and lively mouthfeel with a slight boozy character. Overall a damn fine porter and worthy of the praise, I think the dog in the picture is Joeys that I have met, thankfully the beer does not smell of puppy breath!

Growler from the brewery.  Just filled a couple hours prior to opening.  Dark brown mahogany color pouring with a decent sized head that tapers off to the sides.  The aroma shows chocolate, coffee, and roasted oats.  Very nice.  Flavors follow; roasty with lots of chocolate along with espesso creeping in towards the finish but less prominent than the chocolate.  Caramel and burnt toast adds depth along with a kiss of bitterness.  The drinkability with this one is really good.  All the flavors meld together quite well and the end result is just a really good Porter with no apparent flaw.  I prefer this over Jose Marti which I found good but a bit rough and perhaps too hoppy for me within the style.  I havent had the Rye Porter yet so cant make that comparison.

On tap at the Tampa Pour House pouring up dark rutty ruby red mahogany with off white head and some sticky spotty lacing. The aroma is highly roasted malts, musty dark fruitiness, spicy black licorice and caramel candy. Bold aromatics. The taste is dark roasty malts, spicy notes, black licorice and firm wet clumpy earthiness. Around the edges I get a mild level of bitter pine hops. Another full flavored brew.

Growler from Brewery. Poured a dark brown. Thin mouthfeel. Aroma of roasted nuts and coffee. Flavor was very bitter, no sweetness I could detect. A very solid porter with the flavors of burnt toast, coffee and hints of cocoa powder.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2014 Different from Jose Marti but very good.  A more traditional porter with dominant coffee and cocoa powder notes with slight lingering hop bitterness.  This beer is really, really, really good.

A touch more acidic this go-round, and not as good as before, but probably just my mood that evening.  Slight score drop.
On tap at the brewery.  Poured a dark brown with a small tan head.  The aroma is roasted malt and coffee with hints of chocolate.  The taste followed suit with big expresso and roasted malt flavors.

Growler from the brewery. This one pours a dark mahogany brown color with some reddish tint at the edges and topped by a small tan colored head of foam. The head settles to a thin film leaving spots of lacing on the glass. The aroma is really nice and shows a good amount of depth with notes of rich chocolate, caramel, bitter sweet cocoa and balanced out by some earthy roast, and toasted barley. It smells great. The flavor follows showing a nice balance between the cocoa, caramel, and dark roast. The cocoa and caramel add sweetness, but not overly so staying on the drier side. Some toasted nuts and earthy hops start to come through adding another layer of depth. The roast really shines, but is perfectly balanced by the other flavors. Full bodied and very smooth on the palate with moderate carbonation that leads a to lengthy choco roast finish. This is a great porter, and one of the best I have had in this style.
Growler thanks to drowland. Pours black with tan head. Nose of chocolate and roasted malts. Lots of coffee, vanilla and mocha on the palate with roasted malt finish.

Growler.  Having just tried the Jose Marti hoppy imperial porter from CCB, I can say that this is an entirely different beast....and its just as tasty in its own right.  Pouring a clear, dark mahogany color with glints of backlit reddish-brown hues, the body supports a small, swirly head of yellowish-tan foam.  Settling as a thin ring at the edge, the foam leaves smooth-edged splotches of lacing on the glass.  The nose displays excellent balance, showing rich, chocolaty, caramel brownie notes that are countered with hints of toasted and robust barley roast.  The stuff just smells damn good, and totally approachable.  Flavors follow suit, matching the aroma in depth and balance.  Choco-caramel is rich, yet sufficiently dry, never weighing things down with excess sugars.  Dark roast and toasty, nutty dessert bread notes bring things full circle.  Velvety smooth, with carbonation that is appropriately light to moderate in intensity, the palate shows grace and substance, never getting cloying or laborious.  Great, great porter.  This weighs in right behind Founders masterpiece for me.

32 oz growler shared by Kan. Thanks! Pours a murky brownish dark hue, pretty dark, brownish black roast, with a small frothy light brown head that films and laces small, rings. Aromas are rich chocolatey dark malts, coffee, roasted malts, a touch of soapiness, sweet mellowness. Roasted malts, a bit chalky and dry. Initial mirrors this, thinner end of medium bodied. Roasted malts, brown malts add a light sweetness, earthiness. Pretty nutty, peanuts and cashews, earthy tobbacco, dark bittersweet cocoa. Very earthy porter, with roast and sweetness. Light bitter hopping, dry and a touch pine), warming alcohol. Roasted malts, earthy tobbacco, flourishes of caramel and creamy malts. This is a top notch Porter, no doubt. Finishes earthy, roast, tobbacco, touches of dark cocoa. Pretty dry and roasty, sweetness dials back.  This is a great earthy roasty porter. Great work, CCB!

I dont know, there was just something wrong with this beer, on tap at Proof. There was something that was just missing in the middle of the palate that just threw me off.  Still a very good beer, but i feel like its lacking in relation to the best of the style.

Mason jar growler fill. Thanks to Jason for sending these out... Pours a semi-transparent medium cola brown with a thin light beige head... Aroma of chocolate and dry roast, subtle nuttiness...Flavors are earthy with roasted malt, chocolate, a fair bit of tobacco, and a light earthy hop finish with a tad of bitterness. Medium sweetness through the middle with a nice lasting finish.  On par with the rye porter and better than Jose.

Draft.  Pours a dark brown with a tall, creamy, beige head.  Huge, intense notes of chocolate, roast, and coffee in the nose.  Medium body, extremely smooth texture with ample carbonation.  The flavor is very rich and intense, loads of roast, coffee, and chocolate, some earthy hop notes mid way through as well as light ash and tobacco.  Very robust but still highly drinkable.  Great beer.

On draft at CCB. Pours a dark brown to black with tan head. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of chocolate, roast, coffee, toffee, dark fruits. Flavor is about the same with similar notes of chocolate, toffee, roast, coffee. Medium to full body with a roasty, malty finish.
Bit thin on the backside.  Im not a huge porter fan but this is one of the better ones Ive had.  Rivals Konas Black Sand.  Well worth trying.

Draft @ Vine & Barley. Pours dark brown with brown head. Big chocolate and roasted malt aromas. Flavors of sweet milk chocolate and roasted malts with some bitterness and coffee. Medium body with moderate carbonation. A could drink tons of this stuff.
Weird herbal cherry notes plus chocolate-orange in the nose. Chocolate roast flavors, some herbalness at the finish. Nice medium palate and semi-dry.

A: Pours a deep dark rich black. Nice tall tan head with good retention and lace.

S: Loads of roasted malt and rich chocolate. Light coffee with some dark fruit and a touch of molasses.

T: Wonderfully roasted. Loads of chocolate with strong espresso notes. Hints of smoke and pipe tobacco. Bold and roasty goodness.

M: Medium in body, uber roasty, a bit bitter and dry in the finish.

D: Nice and drinkable. Love this one and the Jose Marti.

Growler thanks to Blazer06.  Pours black in color with a great typical Cigar City head.  Creamy and lasting with great lacing.  Intense smoky cigar box aroma, which I know lots of people hate this, but I love it.  No puppys breath noticeable, but awesomely burnt and roasty with some coffee.  Rich flavors of smoky cigar box and tobacco, dark chocolate, and roasty coffee.  Very charred, with much more roast on the flavor than the aroma.  Dry, burnt mouthfeel with medium body.  Finishes nicely, very drying.  Really an excellent porter overall, although pretty predictable from other CCB porters and stouts.  Im impressed.

Draft at CCB. Pours nearly black with a medium yellow/brown head and good lacing. Aroma is raisins, wood, and tobacco. Flavor is espresso, vanilla bean, and wood. Medium body and nice warmth. Damn good.

I had the pleasure of experiencing Puppys Breath Porter on tap at Cigar City Brewing on the ninth day of September, 2010. Served in a shaker glass, notes of tart dark fruit, roastiness,  leather and a subtle charming sweetness emanated. Holding the glass up to the light quickly illustrated the impenetrability of the dark roasted hue and exhibited a deep brown nature, slightly lighter than your average Pepsi.  A short beige head followed the serving all the way to the end, leaving a thick coating of lacing behind.  The body was thick and characteristic of the style. Couple that with the gentle sweetness, bitter finish and spot on light carbonation, Puppys Breath Porter  made for a truly inspiring experience.  Delicious, nutritious, auspicious, and a few other positive adjectives  that end in ious. Cheers!

Wow.  Pours dark brown with an off-white head.  Nose is lots of chocolate, dry roasted coffee, slight ash, and earth.  Flavor is wonderful blend of chocolate, roast, dry roasted coffee, slight sweetness and a velvety mouthfeel.  Simply outstanding porter.

Draft This beer rocks! Pours hazy and dark brown with a small, creamy, off-white head. Good retention. The robust bouquet offers chocolate, espresso and a notation of cola. Full-bodied and creamy with medium carbonation. Well-balanced flavor. Very roasty with big-time espresso flanked by a nice chocolate element. Sweet mocha finish. World class porter!
On tap at the brewery. Deep brown pour with a thick creamy head. Huge citrus, tangerine hop aroma. Light malt body, some roastiness with a big grapefruit hop bitterness. Real tasty.

9/4/10.  On tap at the brewery.  Solid black pour with red edges and a small dark tan head.  Big chalky chocolate aroma with hints of roast, reminds of a Guinness in a way.  The flavor is creamy, chalky chocolate with obvious roasted malts.  Not quite coffee, but plainly roasted.  Big creamy feel.

Jar filled up by Cigar City...  Poured dark brown -- near black -- with a light, tan head.  Lots of roast, robust aroma.  Chocolate, roasty, almonds, smoked wood, and some coffee too in the flavors.  Lots going on, but still very drinkable.  Nice bitterness that was enhanced by a molasses-like sweetness.
on tap at tasting room great looking great tasting very good beer smelled of wood and roasted malt tasted the same with some chocolate in it nice aftertaste great.
On tap, coffee and wood notes. Dark coffee and chocalate taste. Earthy. Strong finish. Good mouthfeel. A real solid beer.
